snippet: As President Hugo Chávez of Venezuela neared death, Vice President Nicolás Maduro’s imitations of him became apparent. Less clear are Mr. Maduro’s intentions toward the United States.
abstract: Venezuelan Vice Pres Nicolas Maduro's imitation of Pres Hugo Chavez's mannerisms and style, which increased as Chavez neared death, raises questions of how the successor will govern going forward; Maduro likely will have to find his own voice in leading Venezuela, and how he deals with Washington.

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and GINGER THOMPSON
byline.contributor: William Neuman reported from Caracas, and Ginger Thompson from New York. Reporting was contributed by Lizette Alvarez from Miami; María Iguarán from Cumaná, Venezuela; Clifford Krauss from Houston; and Simon Romero from Caracas.

lead_paragraph: As President Hugo Chávez of Venezuela neared death, Vice President Nicolás Maduro’s imitations of him became apparent. Less clear are Mr. Maduro’s intentions toward the United States.

headline.seo: A Leader’s Cry in Venezuela: ‘I Am Chávez’
headline.main: A Leader Cries, ‘I Am Chávez,’ as U.S. Seeks Policy Clues
headline.print_headline: A Leader’s Cry In Venezuela: ‘I Am Chávez’
